page.title: 12 ST.MARYS OR BATES ISLAND.
page.content: Its first recorded owner was T.Bates surveyor to Elizabeth 1.In 1573 it was named Bates Island or Hill.It is a small crop of sandstone belonging to the coal measures of the carbonifeous period and was originally joined to the mainland.Erosion by the sea has turned it into an island at high tide. In medieval times a chapel dedicated to ST.HELEN stood on the island together with a cemetry where shipwreck victims were buried.The last traces of the chapel were lost when the lighthouse was built between 1896-1898 after which the island was mistakenly named ST.MARY'S.In 1855 George Ewen,a fisherman built a cottage and in 1862 it was converted to a pub called "THE SQUARE AND COMPASS".Trinity house who now own the Lighthouse and two houses are selling them.The pub is now a cafe and gift shop.
